awd_titl_txt: RUI Site: Hands on Electrical Engineering Design Projects toSupport Reseach Conducted at the Sacramento Peak National   Observatory
awd_abstract_narration: In a cooperative effort between the National Solar Observatory at               Sacramento Peak and the University of Texas at El Paso, junior and              senior electrical engineering and computer engineering students                 spend the summer working on design projects at UTEP and at the                  Observatory.  At present, Observatory personnel do not have the                 time or resources to retrofit or redesign existing equipment that,              although marginal, functions at an acceptable level.  This opens                the door for many student design projects aimed at optimizing                   existing equipment.  These projects include the design of a serial              handbox interface for telescope control, the development of a noise             insensitive fiber optic link for CCD camera data, and the design                of calibrated timing source for synchronizing                                   instruments used for solar observations.
org_div_long_name: Division of Engineering Education and Centers
